Validators¶

These are miscellaneous functions used by the webpage on the master Pi. At the moment these are all validators.

Account Validator¶

account.py holds the various input validation functions applied to accounts. There is both conditional logic and regular expressions.

class script.model.account.Account(username, password, email, firstname, lastname, phone, user_id='', mac_address='')[source]¶

This class holds all the functions in this file.

static hash_salt_password(raw_input)[source]¶

This hashes a received password before we store it anywhere or compare it to a stored value.

register_account()[source]¶

This registers an account.

update_account()[source]¶

This updates an account.

static validate_email_input(email)[source]¶

Valid email input: 1. Before “@”, minimum length of the text (between 2 dots/underscors) is 2. 2. Has to start with/end with/contain only alphanumerical characters. 3. After “@”, requires 2 alphabetical text with a “.” between. The latter contains 2 to 3 characters.

Returns True if OK, otherwise False.

validate_new_account()[source]¶

This is the validation chain to validate a new account. It must pass all these functions.

If it passes all of them, it returns True. Otherwise it returns False.

static validate_password_input(password)[source]¶

Valid password contains at least: 8 characters, 1 upper case, 1 lower case, 1 digit, 1 special characters

Returns True if it’s OK, otherwise False.

static validate_phone_input(phone)[source]¶

Validate phone contains at least 5 characters, all must be digits.

Returns True if OK, otherwise False.

validate_update_account()[source]¶

These are the validators for when an admin user is updating an account.

Returns True if all pass, and otherwise False.

static validate_username_input(username)[source]¶

Validates that a username merts minimum length requirements and doesn’t have non-allowed characters.

static validate_username_uniqueness(username)[source]¶

Checks a username is unique across both staff and customer user sets.

If it exists, returns True. Otherwise returns False.

static verify_password(username, input_password)[source]¶

Here we verify a password. The password that a user enters is hashed, then compared agaisnt the hash stored in the database.

Returns the user if it’s a match, otherwise returns False.

Booking Validator¶

booking.py holds all the validators used for bookings.

class script.model.booking.Booking(car_id, customer_id, rent_time, return_time, totalCost)[source]¶

This class holds al lthe functions in this file.

static validate_booking_input(cost, start_date, end_date)[source]¶

This is a helper function that combines cost and date validation.

Returns True if both pass, otherwise returns False.

static validate_cost(cost)[source]¶

Make sure any time someone enters a cost, that it can be cleanly converted to a float. It doesn’t have to be an integer, e.g. 5.003 is a valid entry but ‘yellow’ is not.

Returns True if the cost can be cleanly converted to a float, False otherwise.

static validate_date(start_date, end_date)[source]¶

Make sure the start date is before the end date. Booking for negative times would charge negative fees and that would be very bad.

Returns False if the dates are nonsensical, True if they are OK.

Car Validator¶

car.py hold the various alidation functions applied to cars.

class script.model.car.Car(brand, car_type, color, seat, cost, location_id, mac_address='', status='Available')[source]¶

This class holds all the functions in this file.

create_car()[source]¶

Creates a new car.

update_car(car_id)[source]¶

Updates an existing car.

static validate_cost(cost)[source]¶

Cost must be possible to convert into a float ( 3.002 is OK, ‘yellow’ in not”) and also has to be between 1 and 1000. Cars should not rent for less than 1$ or more than 1000$ per hour. Mostly this is to prevent typos.

Returns False if there’s a problem, otherwise True.

static validate_location_id(location_id)[source]¶

Makes sure the location id is an integer. These integers map to locations, e.g. 1 = office parking lot, 2 = downtown mall parking lot.

Returns True if it’s an integer, otherwise False.

validate_new_car()[source]¶

A helper function that combines cost and location validation.

Returns True if both pass, otherwise False.

validate_update_car()[source]¶

Another helper function combining cost and location validation, this time specifically for the update form.

Returns True if both pass, otherwise False.
